dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, B, so, you know how we're always talking about, like, project best practices, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, B, so, you know how we're always talking about, like, project best practices, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally. Everyone's, um, always buzzing about optimizing workflows and closing out strong.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally. Everyone's, um, always buzzing about optimizing workflows and closing out strong.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, I found this article, and it's, uh, quite a take. It's basically a guide on how to *not* close your projects in a functional way.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, I found this article, and it's, uh, quite a take. It's basically a guide on how to not close your projects in a functional way.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Here are six of the steps you can follow to close your projects effectively.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Oh, like, the anti-project manager's handbook? I'm intrigued.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, like, the anti-project manager's handbook? I'm intrigued.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! So, first gem: "Preparing a checklist for your work is absolutely not recommended."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! So, first gem: Preparing a checklist for your work is absolutely not recommended.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In order to avoid a train of challenges arriving during the last stage of your project, it is important to develop a final checklist.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupting] Wait, what? So, just... fly by the seat of your pants? No planning at all?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? So, just... fly by the seat of your pants? No planning at all?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much! The logic is, um, Murphy's Law in reverse: "Anything that can go right will go right!" So, why bother with, you know, setting up challenges?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much! The logic is, um, Murphy's Law in reverse: Anything that can go right will go right! So, why bother with, you know, setting up challenges?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Murphys law states, Anything that can go wrong will go wrong! In order to avoid a train of challenges arriving during the last stage of your project, it is important to develop a final checklist.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. Okay. So ignore deadlines, forget contractual obligations, just, uh, invite total chaos?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. Okay. So ignore deadlines, forget contractual obligations, just, uh, invite total chaos?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. And get this: identifying your target audience? It's, like, the *last* thing you should do.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. And get this: identifying your target audience? It's, like, the last thing you should do.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: From the long-term planning perspective, it is imperative that all your partners, clients, stakeholders, investors and supporters know about the successful closure of the project and about your achievements along the way.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Right, because who needs to know who they're building something for, or, um, what it's even supposed to be?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, because who needs to know who they're building something for, or, um, what it's even supposed to be?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Precisely! And don't even *think* about developing a communication strategy. Just let your message get completely lost.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Precisely! And don't even think about developing a communication strategy. Just let your message get completely lost.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Therefore, you should choose your communication strategy and communication tools wisely so that more people, potential stakeholders and investors and especially your friends and colleagues know about the successful completion of the project and delivered results.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, makes sense. And, uh, my favorite: conducting post-project evaluations? Completely unnecessary.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, makes sense. And, uh, my favorite: conducting post-project evaluations? Completely unnecessary.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Every textbook on project management highlights the importance of post-mortem evaluations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, 100%! Don't, uh, look back. And definitely don't celebrate any successes. Hide the champagne!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, one hundred percent! Don't, uh, look back. And definitely don't celebrate any successes. Hide the champagne!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With your final evaluation, it is important to formally and publicly close your project by celebrating with a grand party or a formal workshop. This is not only an opportunity to open a bottle of champagne...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: [laughs] Hide the champagne! So, if you want your project to, like, spiral into total disarray and obscurity, just do the complete opposite of, well, everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hide the champagne! So, if you want your project to, like, spiral into total disarray and obscurity, just do the complete opposite of, well, everything.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. It's, um, a very unique, albeit disastrous, perspective on project closure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. It's, um, a very unique, albeit disastrous, perspective on project closure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Here are six of the steps you can follow to close your projects effectively.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, it *is* a perspective. I'm not sure I'd, uh, sign up for it, but it certainly makes you think.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, it is a perspective. I'm not sure I'd, uh, sign up for it, but it certainly makes you think.
